Field.label: User Email
Field.toolTip: If you provide an email address, we will notify you when your job has finished processing. This is useful for long requests.

Field.label: Fish Model Algorithm
Field.toolTip: The algorithm to apply for fish movement.

HField.label: Center of Home Range (X value)
HField.toolTip: X value for the center of the home range.

HField.label: Center of Home Range (Y value)
HField.toolTip: Y value for the center of the home range.

HField.label: Attraction Towards Center (X value)
HField.toolTip: X value for the strength of attraction towards the center of the home range.

HField.label: Attraction Towards Center (Y value)
HField.toolTip: Y value for the strength of attraction towards the center of the home range.

HField.label: Attraction Towards Center (XY value)
HField.toolTip: XY value for the strength of attraction towards the center of the home range.

Field.label: Mead Squared Displacement of Fish
Field.toolTip: Mean squared displacement of fish (a proxy for movement capacity).

Field.label: Sampling Time Step
Field.toolTip: Time interval for the simulation.

Field.label: Min suppression Value
Field.toolTip: Specifies the minimum suppression penalty to apply.

Field.label: Restrict Vertical Habitat Range
Field.toolTip: Restricts fish to habitat cells within a given depth range.

HField.label: Min Depth
HField.toolTip: Specifies the shallowest cell a fish will visit.

HField.label: Max Depth
HField.toolTip: Specifies the deepest cell a fish will visit.

Field.label: Use Depth Preference
Field.toolTip: Normally distributes fish in the water column according to a given mean and SD.

HField.label: Preferred Depth
HField.toolTip: Depth preference of fish relative to bottom (in meters off the bottom).

HField.label: SD of Preferred Depth
HField.toolTip: Strength of depth preference as a standard deviation, 95% of the time is spent within plus minus 2*SD.

Field.label: Number of Sensors to Use
Field.toolTip: The number of sensors you wish to place.

Field.label: 'Goodness' Algorithm
Field.toolTip: Determines how the program determines the goodness of a cell. A value of 1 bases goodness on fish habitat, regardless of bathymetry. A value of 2 bases goodness on bathymetric visibility, regardless of fish habitat. A value of 3 bases goodness on the number of visible fish (both fish habitat and bathymetry).

Field.label: Sensor Shape Function
Field.toolTip: Determines which shape function to use for simulating signal attenuation.

Field.label: Max Detection Value
Field.toolTip: The probability of detecting a fish right next to your sensor. Specifies a maximum value for the shape function.

Field.label: SD of Detection Value
Field.toolTip: The standard deviation for your sensor's detection capability.

Field.label: Input File
Field.toolTip: The bathymetry file you wish to use.

Field.label: Input File Type
Field.toolTip: Specifies the file type of the Bathy file you provided. Supported file types are ArcGIS, NetCDF, and ASC.

Field.label: Data Series Name
Field.toolTip: For ArcGIS/NetCDF, this specifies the name of the data series to use.

Field.label: Beginning X Index
Field.toolTip: Specifies the starting X cell-index of the area of interest for the file chosen.

Field.label: X Axis Length
Field.toolTip: Specifies how far the area of interest extends along the X axis.

Field.label: Beginning Y Index
Field.toolTip: Specifies the starting Y cell-index of the area of interest for the file chosen.

Field.label: Y Axis Length
Field.toolTip: Specifies how far the area of interest extends along the Y axis.

Field.label: suppression Function
Field.toolTip: The suppression function to use.

Field.label: suppression Range
Field.toolTip: Specifies the radius of suppression in grid cells. To deter sensor overlap, a good value to use is six times the sensor sd specified above.

Field.label: Max suppression Value
Field.toolTip: Specifies the maximum suppression penalty to apply.

Field.label: Min suppression Value
Field.toolTip: Specifies the minimum suppression penalty to apply.
